title: Impeachment, Secret or Not, Roils the House
text: Regarding your editorial “Impeachment in Secret” (Oct. 9): I was a senior officer at the CIA for nearly 18 years. In my career with the CIA, in industry and as a consultant, I had the opportunity to frequently interact with both the House and Senate Intelligence Committees. The hallmark of these committees over the years was that they were led and managed in a nonpartisan manner no matter which party held the chair of the committee. This nonpartisan approach to their important oversight role gave the committees great credibility, as the participants knew that the members’ fundamental interest was in nonpartisan oversight...
description: It’s time for Nancy Pelosi to call for a vote in the House that would authorize an open investigation with witnesses, cross-examinations, public depositions and witness biographies.
